hydrogen:build.description: Builds a Hydrogen storefront for production.

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

entry.description: Entry file for the worker. Defaults to `./server`.
entry.name: entry

sourcemap.description: Controls whether server sourcemaps are generated. Default to `true`. Deactivate `--no-sourcemaps`.
sourcemap.name: sourcemap

lockfile-check.description: Checks that there is exactly one valid lockfile in the project. Defaults to `true`. Deactivate with `--no-lockfile-check`.
lockfile-check.name: lockfile-check

disable-route-warning.description: Disables any warnings about missing standard routes.
disable-route-warning.name: disable-route-warning

codegen.description: Automatically generates GraphQL types for your project’s Storefront API queries.
codegen.name: codegen

codegen-config-path.description: Specifies a path to a codegen configuration file. Defaults to `<root>/codegen.ts` if this file exists.
codegen-config-path.name: codegen-config-path

diff.description: Applies the current files on top of Hydrogen's starter template in a temporary directory.
diff.name: diff

watch.description: Watches for changes and rebuilds the project writing output to disk.
watch.name: watch

bundle-stats.description: Show a bundle size summary after building. Defaults to true, use `--no-bundle-stats` to disable.
bundle-stats.name: bundle-stats

force-client-sourcemap.description: Client sourcemapping is avoided by default because it makes backend code visible in the browser. Use this flag to force enabling it.
force-client-sourcemap.name: force-client-sourcemap

hydrogen:build.descriptionWithMarkdown: Builds a Hydrogen storefront for production. The client and app worker files are compiled to a `/dist` folder in your Hydrogen project directory.

resource.description: The resource to check. Currently only 'routes' is supported.
resource.name: resource

hydrogen:check.description: Returns diagnostic information about a Hydrogen storefront.

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

hydrogen:check.descriptionWithMarkdown: Checks whether your Hydrogen app includes a set of standard Shopify routes.

hydrogen:codegen.description: Generate types for the Storefront API queries found in your project.

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

codegen-config-path.description: Specify a path to a codegen configuration file. Defaults to `<root>/codegen.ts` if it exists.
codegen-config-path.name: codegen-config-path

force-sfapi-version.description: Force generating Storefront API types for a specific version instead of using the one provided in Hydrogen. A token can also be provided with this format: `<version>:<token>`.
force-sfapi-version.name: force-sfapi-version

watch.description: Watch the project for changes to update types on file save.
watch.name: watch

diff.description: Applies the current files on top of Hydrogen's starter template in a temporary directory.
diff.name: diff

hydrogen:codegen.descriptionWithMarkdown: Automatically generates GraphQL types for your project’s Storefront API queries.

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

storefront-id.description: The id of the storefront the configuration should be pushed to. Must start with 'gid://shopify/HydrogenStorefront/'
storefront-id.name: storefront-id

dev-origin.description: The development domain of your application.
dev-origin.name: dev-origin

relative-redirect-uri.description: The relative url of allowed callback url for Customer Account API OAuth flow. Default is '/account/authorize'
relative-redirect-uri.name: relative-redirect-uri

relative-logout-uri.description: The relative url of allowed url that will be redirected to post-logout for Customer Account API OAuth flow. Default to nothing.
relative-logout-uri.name: relative-logout-uri

hydrogen:debug:cpu.description: Builds and profiles the server startup time the app.

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

diff.description: Applies the current files on top of Hydrogen's starter template in a temporary directory.
diff.name: diff

entry.description: Entry file for the worker. Defaults to `./server`.
entry.name: entry

output.description: Specify a path to generate the profile file. Defaults to "startup.cpuprofile".
output.name: output

hydrogen:debug:cpu.descriptionWithMarkdown:
Builds the app and runs the resulting code to profile the server startup time, watching for changes. This command can be used to [debug slow app startup times](https://shopify.dev/docs/custom-storefronts/hydrogen/debugging/cpu-startup) that cause failed deployments in Oxygen.

  The profiling results are written to a `.cpuprofile` file that can be viewed with certain tools such as [Flame Chart Visualizer for Visual Studio Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.vscode-js-profile-flame).

hydrogen:deploy.description: Builds and deploys a Hydrogen storefront to Oxygen.

entry.description: Entry file for the worker. Defaults to `./server`.
entry.name: entry

env.description: Specifies the environment to perform the operation using its handle. Fetch the handle using the `env list` command.
env.name: env

env-branch.description: Specifies the environment to perform the operation using its Git branch name.
env-branch.name: env-branch

env-file.description: Path to an environment file to override existing environment variables for the deployment.
env-file.name: env-file

preview.description: Deploys to the Preview environment. Overrides Git metadata.
preview.name: preview

force.description: Forces a deployment to proceed if there are uncommited changes in its Git repository.
force.name: force

no-verify.description: Skip the routability verification step after deployment.
no-verify.name: no-verify

auth-bypass-token.description: Generate an authentication bypass token, which can be used to perform end-to-end tests against the deployment.
auth-bypass-token.name: auth-bypass-token

auth-bypass-token-duration.description: Specify the duration (in hours) up to 12 hours for the authentication bypass token. Defaults to `2`
auth-bypass-token-duration.name: auth-bypass-token-duration

build-command.description: Specify a build command to run before deploying. If not specified, `shopify hydrogen build` will be used.
build-command.name: build-command

lockfile-check.description: Checks that there is exactly one valid lockfile in the project. Defaults to `true`. Deactivate with `--no-lockfile-check`.
lockfile-check.name: lockfile-check

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

shop.description: Shop URL. It can be the shop prefix (janes-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (janes-apparel.myshopify.com, https://janes-apparel.myshopify.com).
shop.name: shop

json-output.description: Create a JSON file containing the deployment details in CI environments. Defaults to true, use `--no-json-output` to disable.
json-output.name: json-output

token.description: Oxygen deployment token. Defaults to the linked storefront's token if available.
token.name: token

metadata-description.description: Description of the changes in the deployment. Defaults to the commit message of the latest commit if there are no uncommited changes.
metadata-description.name: metadata-description

metadata-user.description: User that initiated the deployment. Will be saved and displayed in the Shopify admin
metadata-user.name: metadata-user

diff.description: Applies the current files on top of Hydrogen's starter template in a temporary directory.
diff.name: diff

hydrogen:deploy.descriptionWithMarkdown: Builds and deploys your Hydrogen storefront to Oxygen. Requires an Oxygen deployment token to be set with the `--token` flag or an environment variable (`SHOPIFY_HYDROGEN_DEPLOYMENT_TOKEN`). If the storefront is [linked](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli/hydrogen/hydrogen-link) then the Oxygen deployment token for the linked storefront will be used automatically.

disable-deps-optimizer.name: disable-deps-optimizer

legacy-runtime.description: [Classic Remix Compiler] Runs the app in a Node.js sandbox instead of an Oxygen worker.

hydrogen:dev.descriptionWithMarkdown:
Runs a Hydrogen storefront in a local runtime that emulates an Oxygen worker for development.

  If your project is [linked](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli/hydrogen/hydrogen-link) to a Hydrogen storefront, then its environment variables will be loaded with the runtime.

hydrogen:env:list.description: List the environments on your linked Hydrogen storefront.

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

hydrogen:env:list.descriptionWithMarkdown: Lists all environments available on the linked Hydrogen storefront.

hydrogen:env:pull.description: Populate your .env with variables from your Hydrogen storefront.

env-file.name: env-file

path.description: The path to the directory of the Hydrogen storefront. Defaults to the current directory where the command is run.
path.name: path

force.description: Overwrites the destination directory and files if they already exist.
force.name: force

hydrogen:link.description: Link a local project to one of your shop's Hydrogen storefronts.

hydrogen:link.descriptionWithMarkdown:
Links your local development environment to a remote Hydrogen storefront. You can link an unlimited number of development environments to a single Hydrogen storefront.

  Linking to a Hydrogen storefront enables you to run [dev](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli/hydrogen/hydrogen-dev) and automatically inject your linked Hydrogen storefront's environment variables directly into the server runtime.

  After you run the `link` command, you can access the [env list](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli/hydrogen/hydrogen-env-list), [env pull](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli/hydrogen/hydrogen-env-pull), and [unlink](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/shopify-cli/hydrogen/hydrogen-unlink) commands.

path.name: path

hydrogen:shortcut.description: Creates a global `h2` shortcut for the Hydrogen CLI
hydrogen:shortcut.descriptionWithMarkdown:
Creates a global h2 shortcut for Shopify CLI using shell aliases.

  The following shells are supported:

  - Bash (using `~/.bashrc`)
  - ZSH (using `~/.zshrc`)
  - Fish (using `~/.config/fish/functions`)
  - PowerShell (added to `$PROFILE`)

  After the alias is created, you can call Shopify CLI from anywhere in your project using `h2 <command>`.

hydrogen:upgrade.descriptionWithMarkdown: Upgrade Hydrogen project dependencies, preview features, fixes and breaking changes. The command also generates an instruction file for each upgrade.
